Articles.Content:
I keep getting errors with proptools.cs in unity and it is made me unable to export parts!

I keep getting told that the script needs to be compiled with part tools, and even when it is compiled, I get compiling errors.

Here is some of the errors I am getting:

Assets/Plugins/KSP/PropTools.cs(132,55): error CS1061: Type `System.IO.FileInfo' does not contain a definition for `Directory' and no extension method `Directory' of type `System.IO.FileInfo' could be found (are you missing a using directive or an assembly reference?)

Assets/Plugins/KSP/PropTools.cs(123,34): error CS1503: Argument `#1' cannot convert `object' expression to type `string'

Assets/Plugins/KSP/PropTools.cs(123,34): error CS1502: The best overloaded method match for `PropTools.CreateProxyInfo(string, string)' has some invalid arguments

Can anyone help with this? C7, Mu, or someone who has a working version of the .16 part tools?

Edited August 12, 2012 by Nutt007
Does anyone know how to fix this?
Is unity installed in a directory with a single quote or something in it?

Is unity installed in a directory with a single quote or something in it?

What do you mean?

He's asking if you have anything but alphanumerics in the folders your're working in. i.e. C:\Bob's Folder\Unity\

I think he was alluding to the fact that having an apostrophe or a space in the path might be tripping the software up.

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

He's asking if you have anything but alphanumerics in the folders your're working in. i.e. C:\Bob's Folder\Unity\

I think he was alluding to the fact that having an apostrophe or a space in the path might be tripping the software up.

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

It's in Program Files.

I SOLVED IT! I had to clear out any onld Unity projects from .15. Finally, time to work!

How to add ladders?

How to add ladders?
I've found DYJ's tutorial helpful: http://kspwiki.nexisonline.net/wiki/Adding_Airlocks_and_Ladders_to_Parts

I've found DYJ's tutorial helpful: http://kspwiki.nexisonline.net/wiki/Adding_Airlocks_and_Ladders_to_Parts
